result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Emerson Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick Emerson Jr. not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared by video for Derrick Emerson Jr.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant in custody at Dodge Correctional, not produced. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Derrick Emerson Jr. not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Lamke has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derrick Emerson Jr. not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Derrick Emerson in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Derrick Emerson in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick Emerson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
